required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Combination of AKR1B10 and CA19-9 Improves the Diagnosis of PDAC
clinical_study.official_title: A Combination of AKR1B10 and CA19-9 Improves the Diagnosis of Pancreatic Ductal Adenocarcinoma：A Multicenter Study

lead_sponsor.agency: Shanghai General Hospital, Shanghai Jiao Tong University School of Medicine

clinical_study.source: Shanghai General Hospital, Shanghai Jiao Tong University School of Medicine

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to clarify the diagnostic significance of AKR1B10 in patients with pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma, and to combine with CA19-9 to improve the diagnosis rate of pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma.

primary_outcome.measure: the value of CA199 AND AKR1B10 before surgery
primary_outcome.description: Carbohydrate antigen 19-9 (CA19-9) is the conventional biomarker used to assessing disease progression in PDAC patients，AKR1B10 may be a potential tumor biomarker.

primary_outcome.measure: the value of CA199 AND AKR1B10 on the first day after surgery
primary_outcome.description: Carbohydrate antigen 19-9 (CA19-9) is the conventional biomarker used to assessing disease progression in PDAC patients，AKR1B10 may be a potential tumor biomarker.

primary_outcome.measure: the value of CA199 AND AKR1B10 on the third day after surgery
primary_outcome.description: Carbohydrate antigen 19-9 (CA19-9) is the conventional biomarker used to assessing disease progression in PDAC patients，AKR1B10 may be a potential tumor biomarker.

study_pop.textblock: The population included in the case group was patients with clinically and pathologically clear pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma, and the population included in the control group was a healthy population without any benign or malignant diseases.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: Shanghai General Hospital, Shanghai Jiao Tong University School of Medicine
responsible_party.investigator_title: Director of Hepatobiliary and Pancreatic Surgery
